page.title: 10Ecology of Priors Marston
page.content: {Village.}Sheltered by steep hillside to east; small fields, unkempt hedges & copses. Wide range of tree species, only 25% were elm & died. Variety of nest habitats encourage rarer birds (green finch, song thrush). New lake at The Manor improving landscape & wildlife value. Footpaths well used. {Surrounding Countryside.}Intensive arable farming in large fields; few hedgerow trees, 60% were elms & died, smaller ash & few oak left. No woods, lakes; few meadows, spinneys; neat hedges; fox & occasional badger; only common birds. New copses provide cover for 1000 pheasants. Single cut of road verges increasing botanical interest. Few use unmarked, unattractive paths. {Noise.}Little traffic; occasional low flying jet or late pub closing. {Pollution.}Only September stubble burning; coal & wood fires in winter.
